00039 static void trimSpaces(string& str)
00040 {
00041         // Trim Both leading and trailing spaces
00042         size_t startpos = str.find_first_not_of(" \t"); // Find the first character position after excluding leading blank spaces
00043         size_t endpos = str.find_last_not_of(" \t");            // Find the first character position from reverse af
00044 
00045         // if all spaces or empty return an empty string
00046         if(( string::npos == startpos ) || ( string::npos == endpos))
00047         {
00048                 str = "";
00049         }
00050         else
00051                 str = str.substr( startpos, endpos-startpos+1 );
00052 }
00053 
00054 static vector<string> split(const string& inputString, const string& delim)
00055 {
00056         vector<string> tokens;
00057         size_t substrBegin = 0;
00058         for (;;)
00059         {
00060                 size_t substrEnd = inputString.find (delim, substrBegin);
00061                 if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00062                 {
00063                         // No more delim - save what's left, quit.
00064                         string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00065                         trimSpaces(subString);
00066                         // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating '?' or an empty inputString.
00067                         if (! subString.empty())
00068                                 tokens.push_back (subString);
00069                         break;
00070                 }
00071                 // Avoid null strings from an initial 'delim' or 'delimdelim'.
00072                 if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00073                 {
00074                         string token(inputString.substr(substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin));
00075                         trimSpaces(token);
00076                         tokens.push_back (token);
00077                 }
00078                 // Continue following the delim
00079                 substrBegin = substrEnd + delim.size();
00080         }
00081         return tokens;
00082 }
00083 
00084 pair<string, string> decodeReportStandAlleleCodePair(string ac, string dsa)
00085 {
00086         string delim = "//";
00087 
00088         vector<string> alleleCodes = split(ac, delim);
00089         vector<string> reportAllele = split(dsa, delim);
00090 
00091         if (alleleCodes.size() != 2)
00092         {
00093                 Err::errAbort("Report Strand Allele decoding expects two channels.");
00094         }
00095 
00096         if (alleleCodes.size() != reportAllele.size())
00097         {
00098                 Err::errAbort("Allele Code-Report Strand Allele mismatch - Allele Code: " + ac + ", Report Strand Allele:" + dsa);
00099         }
00100 
00101         if (alleleCodes[0] == "A")
00102         {
00103                 return make_pair<string, string>(reportAllele[0], reportAllele[1]);
00104         }
00105         else
00106         {
00107                 return make_pair<string, string>(reportAllele[1], reportAllele[0]);
00108         }
00109 }

00113 GenotypeTranslationEngine * GenotypeTranslationEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00114 {
00115         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == GenotypeTranslationEngine::EngineName())
00116                 return (GenotypeTranslationEngine *)engine;
00117         return NULL;
00118 }

00129 void GenotypeTranslationEngine::defineOptions()
00130 {
00131         defineOption("", "calls-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00132                 "Text file specifying genotype calls process.",
00133                 "");
00134         defineOption("", "annotation-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00135                 "The annotation file.",
00136                 "");
00137         defineOption("", "translation-out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00138                 "File to write allele calls results into.",
00139                 "");
00140         defineOption("", "probeset-id-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00141                 "The probe set id column header.",
00142                 "Probeset Id");
00143         defineOption("", "report-strand-allele-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00144                 "The design strand allele column header.",
00145                 "Report Strand Allele");
00146         defineOption("", "allele-code-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00147                 "The allele code column header.",
00148                 "Allele Code");
00149 }

00153 /**
00154  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00155  */
00156 void GenotypeTranslationEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00157 {
00158     defineStates();
00159         string val = getOpt("calls-file");
00160         if (val.empty() == true)
00161                 Err::errAbort("Must specify a call file.");
00162         
00163         val = getOpt("annotation-file");
00164         if (val.empty() == true)
00165                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an annotation file.");
00166 
00167         val = getOpt("translation-out-file");
00168         if (val.empty() == true)
00169                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output file.");
00170 
00171         val = getOpt("probeset-id-col");
00172         if (val.empty() == true)
00173                 Err::errAbort("probeset id column.");
00174 
00175         val = getOpt("report-strand-allele-col");
00176         if (val.empty() == true)
00177                 Err::errAbort("Must specify a design strand allele column.");
00178 
00179         val = getOpt("allele-code-col");
00180         if (val.empty() == true)
00181                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an allele code column.");
00182 }

00184 void GenotypeTranslationEngine::writeHeader(std::ofstream &out)
00185 {
00186         std::vector<std::string> option_names;
00187         getOptionNames(option_names);
00188         std::vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> option_types;
00189         getOptionTypes(option_types);
00190         for (int i = 0; i < option_names.size(); i++) 
00191         {
00192                 switch (option_types[i]) 
00193                 {
00194                 case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00195                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptBool(option_names[i]) << endl;
00196                         break;
00197                 case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00198                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptDouble(option_names[i]) << endl;
00199                         break;
00200                 case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00201                         out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOptInt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00202                         break;
00203                 case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00204                         if (getOpt(option_names[i]).empty() == false)
00205                                 out << "#%" << option_names[i] << "=" << getOpt(option_names[i]) << endl;
00206                 }
00207         }
00208 }

00210 /**
00211    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00212 */
00213 void GenotypeTranslationEngine::runImp()
00214 {
00215         // Check and get the options
00216         string callFile = getOpt("calls-file");
00217         string annotFile = getOpt("annotation-file");
00218         string outFile = getOpt("translation-out-file");
00219         string psidCol = getOpt("probeset-id-col");
00220         string dsaCol = getOpt("report-strand-allele-col");
00221         string acCol = getOpt("allele-code-col");
00222 
00223         // Open the input annotation file and create a map of probeset id to design strand allele.
00224         Verbose::out(1, "Opening annotation file");
00225         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00226         if(tsv.open(annotFile) != TSV_OK)
00227                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + annotFile);
00228         int numChannels = 1;
00229         if (tsv.getHeader("num-channels", numChannels) != TSV_OK)
00230         {
00231                 // If the header is missing, assume it is one channel
00232                 numChannels = 1;
00233         }
00234         tsv.rewind();
00235         map<string, pair<string, string> > translationMap;
00236         string psid;
00237         string dsa;
00238         string ac;
00239         tsv.bind(0, psidCol, &psid, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00240         tsv.bind(0, dsaCol, &dsa, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00241         tsv.bind(0, acCol, &ac, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00242         Verbose::out(1, "Reading annotation file");
00243         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00244         {
00245                 if (translationMap.find(psid) == translationMap.end())
00246                         translationMap[psid] = make_pair<string, string>("", "");
00247 
00248                 if (numChannels == 1)
00249                 {
00250                         if (ac == "A")
00251                                 translationMap[psid].first = dsa;
00252                         else
00253                                 translationMap[psid].second = dsa;
00254                 }
00255                 else
00256                 {
00257                         translationMap[psid] = decodeReportStandAlleleCodePair(ac, dsa);
00258                 }
00259         }
00260         tsv.clear();
00261 
00262         // Open the input call file
00263         Verbose::out(1, "Opening call file");
00264         if(tsv.open(callFile) != TSV_OK)
00265                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open the file: " + callFile);
00266         tsv.rewind();
00267 
00268         // Create an output file and write the header
00269         ofstream out(outFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00270         writeHeader(out);
00271         out << "#Allele Calls" << endl;
00272         int n = tsv.getColumnCount(0);
00273         for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00274         {
00275                 out << tsv.getColumnName(0, i);
00276                 if (i < n - 1)
00277                         out << "\t";
00278         }
00279         out << endl;
00280 
00281         // Bind the calls.
00282         vector<int> calls(n-1);
00283         string marker;
00284         tsv.bind(0, 0, &marker, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00285         for (int i=1; i<n; i++)
00286                 tsv.bind(0, i, &calls[i-1], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00287 
00288         // Translate the calls and output the results
00289         while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00290         {
00291                 bool found = true;
00292                 map<string, pair<string, string> >::iterator it = translationMap.find(marker);
00293                 if (it == translationMap.end())
00294                 {
00295                         out << marker;
00296                         for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00297                         {
00298                                 out << "\t";
00299                                 switch (calls[i])
00300                                 {
00301                                 case 0:
00302                                         out << "<AA>";
00303                                         break;
00304                                 case 1:
00305                                         out << "<AB>";
00306                                         break;
00307                                 case 2:
00308                                         out << "<BB>";
00309                                         break;
00310                                 default:
00311                                         out << "<NoCall>";
00312                                         break;
00313                                 }
00314                         }
00315                         out << endl;
00316                 }
00317                 else
00318                 {
00319                         out << marker;
00320                         const pair<string, string> &tt = it->second;
00321                         for (int i=0; i<n-1; i++)
00322                         {
00323                                 out << "\t";
00324                                 switch (calls[i])
00325                                 {
00326                                 case 0:
00327                                         out << tt.first << "/" << tt.first;
00328                                         break;
00329                                 case 1:
00330                                         out << tt.first << "/" << tt.second;
00331                                         break;
00332                                 case 2:
00333                                         out << tt.second << "/" << tt.second;
00334                                         break;
00335                                 default:
00336                                         out << "NoCall";
00337                                         break;
00338                                 }
00339                         }
00340                         out << endl;
00341                 }
00342         }
00343 
00344         // Close the input and output files.
00345         out.close();
00346         tsv.close();
00347 }
